snippet: A man arrested Tuesday has confessed to attacks in Queens and on Long Island on New Year’s Day, the police said.
abstract: Ray Lezier Lengend of Queens has admitted to having committed five firebomb attacks in Queens and in Nassau County in a two-hour swirl of violence on New Year's Day; authorities say Lengend apparently selected his targets to settle personal scores; he faces five counts of criminal possession of a weapon, one count of arson as a hate crime and four counts of arson.

byline.contributor: Joseph Goldstein and Tim Stelloh contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A man arrested Tuesday has confessed to attacks in Queens and on Long Island on New Year’s Day, the police said.

headline.seo: Firebomber Picked Targets to Settle Scores, N.Y.C. Police Say
headline.main: Firebomber Picked Targets to Settle Personal Scores, Police Say
headline.print_headline: Firebomber Picked His Targets to Settle Personal Scores, the Police Say
